config.task_str:
Please find all developers' branches in the `BenchTasksCollv3` project for the most recent commits that added new tasks. For each person’s new tasks, check the development status (do not check the file content). If the implementation satisfies the requirements, it is considered implemented; otherwise, it is considered implementing. Update our Notion page: `Task Tracker` based on the new tasks, and create a new branch in GitHub named finalpool, adding all of the implemented tasks in Notion Page to finalpool, with the relative path in the project being `tasks/finalpool`.

Tips:

- You could find the requirements in `tasks/examples`
- In addition to the content requirements explicitly mentioned in the examples, only the existence of the file needs to be checked

system_prompts.agent:
Accessible workspace directory: /workspace/dumps/workspace
When processing tasks, if you need to read/write local files and the user provides a relative path, you need to combine it with the above workspace directory to get the complete path.
If you believe the task is completed, you can either call the `local-claim_done` tool or respond without calling any tool to indicate completion. This will immediately terminate the task, and you will have no further opportunity to work on it.
Please complete the given task independently. Do not seek confirmation or additional feedback from the user. You should handle all situations on your own, as the user will not provide any further information.

function.name: github-add_comment_to_pending_review
function.description: Add review comment to the requester's latest pending pull request review. A pending review needs to already exist to call this (check with the user if not sure).

body.description: The text of the review comment

line.description: The line of the blob in the pull request diff that the comment applies to. For multi-line comments, the last line of the range

path.description: The relative path to the file that necessitates a comment

side.description: The side of the diff to comment on. LEFT indicates the previous state, RIGHT indicates the new state

startLine.description: For multi-line comments, the first line of the range that the comment applies to

startSide.description: For multi-line comments, the starting side of the diff that the comment applies to. LEFT indicates the previous state, RIGHT indicates the new state

subjectType.description: The level at which the comment is targeted

function.name: github-add_issue_comment
function.description: Add a comment to a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

function.name: github-add_sub_issue
function.description: Add a sub-issue to a parent issue in a GitHub repository.

issue_number.description: The number of the parent issue

replace_parent.description: When true, replaces the sub-issue's current parent issue

sub_issue_id.description: The ID of the sub-issue to add. ID is not the same as issue number

function.name: github-assign_copilot_to_issue
function.description:
Assign Copilot to a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

This tool can help with the following outcomes:
- a Pull Request created with source code changes to resolve the issue


More information can be found at:
- https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/using-github-copilot/using-copilot-coding-agent-to-work-on-tasks/about-assigning-tasks-to-copilot

function.name: github-cancel_workflow_run
function.description: Cancel a workflow run

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

function.name: github-create_and_submit_pull_request_review
function.description: Create and submit a review for a pull request without review comments.

function.name: github-create_branch
function.description: Create a new branch in a GitHub repository

function.name: github-create_gist
function.description: Create a new gist

content.description: Content for simple single-file gist creation

filename.description: Filename for simple single-file gist creation

function.name: github-create_issue
function.description: Create a new issue in a GitHub repository.

assignees.description: Usernames to assign to this issue

labels.description: Labels to apply to this issue

function.name: github-create_or_update_file
function.description: Create or update a single file in a GitHub repository. If updating, you must provide the SHA of the file you want to update. Use this tool to create or update a file in a GitHub repository remotely; do not use it for local file operations.

branch.description: Branch to create/update the file in

path.description: Path where to create/update the file

sha.description: Required if updating an existing file. The blob SHA of the file being replaced.

function.name: github-create_pending_pull_request_review
function.description: Create a pending review for a pull request. Call this first before attempting to add comments to a pending review, and ultimately submitting it. A pending pull request review means a pull request review, it is pending because you create it first and submit it later, and the PR author will not see it until it is submitted.

function.name: github-create_pull_request
function.description: Create a new pull request in a GitHub repository.

function.name: github-create_repository
function.description: Create a new GitHub repository in your account or specified organization

organization.description: Organization to create the repository in (omit to create in your personal account)

function.name: github-delete_file
function.description: Delete a file from a GitHub repository

branch.description: Branch to delete the file from

path.description: Path to the file to delete

function.name: github-delete_pending_pull_request_review
function.description: Delete the requester's latest pending pull request review. Use this after the user decides not to submit a pending review, if you don't know if they already created one then check first.

function.name: github-delete_workflow_run_logs
function.description: Delete logs for a workflow run

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

function.name: github-dismiss_notification
function.description: Dismiss a notification by marking it as read or done

state.description: The new state of the notification (read/done)

threadID.description: The ID of the notification thread

function.name: github-download_workflow_run_artifact
function.description: Get download URL for a workflow run artifact

artifact_id.description: The unique identifier of the artifact

function.name: github-fork_repository
function.description: Fork a GitHub repository to your account or specified organization

name.description: Custom name for the forked repository

function.name: github-get_code_scanning_alert
function.description: Get details of a specific code scanning alert in a GitHub repository.

function.name: github-get_commit
function.description: Get details for a commit from a GitHub repository

include_diff.description: Whether to include file diffs and stats in the response. Default is true.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

sha.description: Commit SHA, branch name, or tag name

function.name: github-get_dependabot_alert
function.description: Get details of a specific dependabot alert in a GitHub repository.

function.name: github-get_discussion
function.description: Get a specific discussion by ID

function.name: github-get_discussion_comments
function.description: Get comments from a discussion

after.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the endCursor from the previous page's PageInfo for GraphQL APIs.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

function.name: github-get_file_contents
function.description: Get the contents of a file or directory from a GitHub repository

path.description: Path to file/directory (directories must end with a slash '/')

ref.description: Accepts optional git refs such as `refs/tags/{tag}`, `refs/heads/{branch}` or `refs/pull/{pr_number}/head`

sha.description: Accepts optional commit SHA. If specified, it will be used instead of ref

function.name: github-get_global_security_advisory
function.description: Get a global security advisory

function.name: github-get_issue
function.description: Get details of a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

function.name: github-get_issue_comments
function.description: Get comments for a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

function.name: github-get_job_logs
function.description: Download logs for a specific workflow job or efficiently get all failed job logs for a workflow run

failed_only.description: When true, gets logs for all failed jobs in run_id

job_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow job (required for single job logs)

return_content.description: Returns actual log content instead of URLs

run_id.description: Workflow run ID (required when using failed_only)

tail_lines.description: Number of lines to return from the end of the log

function.name: github-get_latest_release
function.description: Get the latest release in a GitHub repository

function.name: github-get_me
function.description: Get details of the authenticated GitHub user. Use this when a request is about the user's own profile for GitHub. Or when information is missing to build other tool calls.

function.name: github-get_notification_details
function.description: Get detailed information for a specific GitHub notification, always call this tool when the user asks for details about a specific notification, if you don't know the ID list notifications first.

function.name: github-get_pull_request
function.description: Get details of a specific pull request in a GitHub repository.

function.name: github-get_pull_request_comments
function.description: Get comments for a specific pull request.

function.name: github-get_pull_request_diff
function.description: Get the diff of a pull request.

function.name: github-get_pull_request_files
function.description: Get the files changed in a specific pull request.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

function.name: github-get_pull_request_reviews
function.description: Get reviews for a specific pull request.

function.name: github-get_pull_request_status
function.description: Get the status of a specific pull request.

function.name: github-get_release_by_tag
function.description: Get a specific release by its tag name in a GitHub repository

function.name: github-get_secret_scanning_alert
function.description: Get details of a specific secret scanning alert in a GitHub repository.

function.name: github-get_tag
function.description: Get details about a specific git tag in a GitHub repository

function.description: Get member usernames of a specific team in an organization. Limited to organizations accessible with current credentials

org.description: Organization login (owner) that contains the team.

function.name: github-get_teams
function.description: Get details of the teams the user is a member of. Limited to organizations accessible with current credentials

user.description: Username to get teams for. If not provided, uses the authenticated user.

function.name: github-get_workflow_run
function.description: Get details of a specific workflow run

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

function.name: github-get_workflow_run_logs
function.description: Download logs for a specific workflow run (EXPENSIVE: downloads ALL logs as ZIP. Consider using get_job_logs with failed_only=true for debugging failed jobs)

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

function.name: github-get_workflow_run_usage
function.description: Get usage metrics for a workflow run

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

function.name: github-list_branches
function.description: List branches in a GitHub repository

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

function.name: github-list_code_scanning_alerts
function.description: List code scanning alerts in a GitHub repository.

ref.description: The Git reference for the results you want to list.

severity.description: Filter code scanning alerts by severity

state.description: Filter code scanning alerts by state. Defaults to open

tool_name.description: The name of the tool used for code scanning.

function.name: github-list_commits
function.description: Get list of commits of a branch in a GitHub repository. Returns at least 30 results per page by default, but can return more if specified using the perPage parameter (up to 100).

author.description: Author username or email address to filter commits by

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

sha.description: Commit SHA, branch or tag name to list commits of. If not provided, uses the default branch of the repository. If a commit SHA is provided, will list commits up to that SHA.

function.name: github-list_dependabot_alerts
function.description: List dependabot alerts in a GitHub repository.

state.description: Filter dependabot alerts by state. Defaults to open

function.name: github-list_discussion_categories
function.description: List discussion categories with their id and name, for a repository or organisation.

repo.description: Repository name. If not provided, discussion categories will be queried at the organisation level.

function.name: github-list_discussions
function.description: List discussions for a repository or organisation.

after.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the endCursor from the previous page's PageInfo for GraphQL APIs.

category.description: Optional filter by discussion category ID. If provided, only discussions with this category are listed.

orderBy.description: Order discussions by field. If provided, the 'direction' also needs to be provided.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

repo.description: Repository name. If not provided, discussions will be queried at the organisation level.

function.name: github-list_gists
function.description: List gists for a user

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

since.description: Only gists updated after this time (ISO 8601 timestamp)

username.description: GitHub username (omit for authenticated user's gists)

function.name: github-list_global_security_advisories
function.description: List global security advisories from GitHub.

affects.description: Filter advisories by affected package or version (e.g. "package1,package2@1.0.0").

cwes.description: Filter by Common Weakness Enumeration IDs (e.g. ["79", "284", "22"]).

ghsaId.description: Filter by GitHub Security Advisory ID (format: GHSA-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx).

isWithdrawn.description: Whether to only return withdrawn advisories.

modified.description: Filter by publish or update date or date range (ISO 8601 date or range).

published.description: Filter by publish date or date range (ISO 8601 date or range).

updated.description: Filter by update date or date range (ISO 8601 date or range).

function.name: github-list_issue_types
function.description: List supported issue types for repository owner (organization).

owner.description: The organization owner of the repository

function.name: github-list_issues
function.description: List issues in a GitHub repository. For pagination, use the 'endCursor' from the previous response's 'pageInfo' in the 'after' parameter.

after.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the endCursor from the previous page's PageInfo for GraphQL APIs.

direction.description: Order direction. If provided, the 'orderBy' also needs to be provided.

orderBy.description: Order issues by field. If provided, the 'direction' also needs to be provided.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

state.description: Filter by state, by default both open and closed issues are returned when not provided

function.name: github-list_notifications
function.description: Lists all GitHub notifications for the authenticated user, including unread notifications, mentions, review requests, assignments, and updates on issues or pull requests. Use this tool whenever the user asks what to work on next, requests a summary of their GitHub activity, wants to see pending reviews, or needs to check for new updates or tasks. This tool is the primary way to discover actionable items, reminders, and outstanding work on GitHub. Always call this tool when asked what to work on next, what is pending, or what needs attention in GitHub.

before.description: Only show notifications updated before the given time (ISO 8601 format)

filter.description: Filter notifications to, use default unless specified. Read notifications are ones that have already been acknowledged by the user. Participating notifications are those that the user is directly involved in, such as issues or pull requests they have commented on or created.

owner.description: Optional repository owner. If provided with repo, only notifications for this repository are listed.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

repo.description: Optional repository name. If provided with owner, only notifications for this repository are listed.

since.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time (ISO 8601 format)

function.name: github-list_org_repository_security_advisories
function.description: List repository security advisories for a GitHub organization.

function.name: github-list_pull_requests
function.description: List pull requests in a GitHub repository. If the user specifies an author, then DO NOT use this tool and use the search_pull_requests tool instead.

head.description: Filter by head user/org and branch

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

function.description: List releases in a GitHub repository

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

function.name: github-list_repository_security_advisories
function.description: List repository security advisories for a GitHub repository.

function.name: github-list_secret_scanning_alerts
function.description: List secret scanning alerts in a GitHub repository.

secret_type.description: A comma-separated list of secret types to return. All default secret patterns are returned. To return generic patterns, pass the token name(s) in the parameter.

function.name: github-list_sub_issues
function.description: List sub-issues for a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

per_page.description: Number of results per page (max 100, default: 30)

function.name: github-list_tags
function.description: List git tags in a GitHub repository

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

function.name: github-list_workflow_jobs
function.description: List jobs for a specific workflow run

filter.description: Filters jobs by their completed_at timestamp

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

function.name: github-list_workflow_run_artifacts
function.description: List artifacts for a workflow run

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

function.name: github-list_workflow_runs
function.description: List workflow runs for a specific workflow

actor.description: Returns someone's workflow runs. Use the login for the user who created the workflow run.

branch.description: Returns workflow runs associated with a branch. Use the name of the branch.

event.description: Returns workflow runs for a specific event type

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

status.description: Returns workflow runs with the check run status

workflow_id.description: The workflow ID or workflow file name

function.name: github-list_workflows
function.description: List workflows in a repository

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

function.name: github-manage_notification_subscription
function.description: Manage a notification subscription: ignore, watch, or delete a notification thread subscription.

action.description: Action to perform: ignore, watch, or delete the notification subscription.

notificationID.description: The ID of the notification thread.

function.name: github-manage_repository_notification_subscription
function.description: Manage a repository notification subscription: ignore, watch, or delete repository notifications subscription for the provided repository.

action.description: Action to perform: ignore, watch, or delete the repository notification subscription.

owner.description: The account owner of the repository.

function.name: github-mark_all_notifications_read
function.description: Mark all notifications as read

lastReadAt.description: Describes the last point that notifications were checked (optional). Default: Now

owner.description: Optional repository owner. If provided with repo, only notifications for this repository are marked as read.

repo.description: Optional repository name. If provided with owner, only notifications for this repository are marked as read.

function.name: github-merge_pull_request
function.description: Merge a pull request in a GitHub repository.

function.name: github-push_files
function.description: Push multiple files to a GitHub repository in a single commit

files.description: Array of file objects to push, each object with path (string) and content (string)

function.name: github-remove_sub_issue
function.description: Remove a sub-issue from a parent issue in a GitHub repository.

issue_number.description: The number of the parent issue

sub_issue_id.description: The ID of the sub-issue to remove. ID is not the same as issue number

function.name: github-rename_repository
function.description: Rename a GitHub repository

function.name: github-reprioritize_sub_issue
function.description: Reprioritize a sub-issue to a different position in the parent issue's sub-issue list.

after_id.description: The ID of the sub-issue to be prioritized after (either after_id OR before_id should be specified)

before_id.description: The ID of the sub-issue to be prioritized before (either after_id OR before_id should be specified)

issue_number.description: The number of the parent issue

sub_issue_id.description: The ID of the sub-issue to reprioritize. ID is not the same as issue number

function.name: github-request_copilot_review
function.description: Request a GitHub Copilot code review for a pull request. Use this for automated feedback on pull requests, usually before requesting a human reviewer.

function.name: github-rerun_failed_jobs
function.description: Re-run only the failed jobs in a workflow run

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

function.name: github-rerun_workflow_run
function.description: Re-run an entire workflow run

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

function.name: github-run_workflow
function.description: Run an Actions workflow by workflow ID or filename

ref.description: The git reference for the workflow. The reference can be a branch or tag name.

workflow_id.description: The workflow ID (numeric) or workflow file name (e.g., main.yml, ci.yaml)

function.name: github-search_code
function.description: Fast and precise code search across ALL GitHub repositories using GitHub's native search engine. Best for finding exact symbols, functions, classes, or specific code patterns.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: Search query using GitHub's powerful code search syntax. Examples: 'content:Skill language:Java org:github', 'NOT is:archived language:Python OR language:go', 'repo:github/github-mcp-server'. Supports exact matching, language filters, path filters, and more.

function.name: github-search_issues
function.description: Search for issues in GitHub repositories using issues search syntax already scoped to is:issue

owner.description: Optional repository owner. If provided with repo, only issues for this repository are listed.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: Search query using GitHub issues search syntax

repo.description: Optional repository name. If provided with owner, only issues for this repository are listed.

sort.description: Sort field by number of matches of categories, defaults to best match

function.name: github-search_orgs
function.description: Find GitHub organizations by name, location, or other organization metadata. Ideal for discovering companies, open source foundations, or teams.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: Organization search query. Examples: 'microsoft', 'location:california', 'created:>=2025-01-01'. Search is automatically scoped to type:org.

function.name: github-search_pull_requests
function.description: Search for pull requests in GitHub repositories using issues search syntax already scoped to is:pr

owner.description: Optional repository owner. If provided with repo, only pull requests for this repository are listed.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: Search query using GitHub pull request search syntax

repo.description: Optional repository name. If provided with owner, only pull requests for this repository are listed.

sort.description: Sort field by number of matches of categories, defaults to best match

function.name: github-search_repositories
function.description: Find GitHub repositories by name, description, readme, topics, or other metadata. Perfect for discovering projects, finding examples, or locating specific repositories across GitHub.

minimal_output.description: Return minimal repository information (default: true). When false, returns full GitHub API repository objects.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: Repository search query. Examples: 'machine learning in:name stars:>1000 language:python', 'topic:react', 'user:facebook'. Supports advanced search syntax for precise filtering.

function.name: github-search_users
function.description: Find GitHub users by username, real name, or other profile information. Useful for locating developers, contributors, or team members.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: User search query. Examples: 'john smith', 'location:seattle', 'followers:>100'. Search is automatically scoped to type:user.

sort.description: Sort users by number of followers or repositories, or when the person joined GitHub.

function.name: github-submit_pending_pull_request_review
function.description: Submit the requester's latest pending pull request review, normally this is a final step after creating a pending review, adding comments first, unless you know that the user already did the first two steps, you should check before calling this.

body.description: The text of the review comment

function.name: github-update_gist
function.description: Update an existing gist

gist_id.description: ID of the gist to update

function.name: github-update_issue
function.description: Update an existing issue in a GitHub repository.

function.name: github-update_pull_request
function.description: Update an existing pull request in a GitHub repository.

draft.description: Mark pull request as draft (true) or ready for review (false)

reviewers.description: GitHub usernames to request reviews from

function.name: github-update_pull_request_branch
function.description: Update the branch of a pull request with the latest changes from the base branch.

expectedHeadSha.description: The expected SHA of the pull request's HEAD ref

function.name: notion-API-get-user
function.description: Notion | Retrieve a user

function.name: notion-API-get-users
function.description: Notion | List all users

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

function.name: notion-API-get-self
function.description: Notion | Retrieve your token's bot user

function.name: notion-API-post-database-query
function.description: Notion | Query a database

filter_properties.description: A list of page property value IDs associated with the database. Use this param to limit the response to a specific page property value or values for pages that meet the `filter` criteria.

filter.description: When supplied, limits which pages are returned based on the [filter conditions](ref:post-database-query-filter).

sorts.description: When supplied, orders the results based on the provided [sort criteria](ref:post-database-query-sort).

start_cursor.description: When supplied, returns a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

function.name: notion-API-post-search
function.description: Notion | Search by title

query.description: The text that the API compares page and database titles against.

sort.description: A set of criteria, `direction` and `timestamp` keys, that orders the results. The **only** supported timestamp value is `"last_edited_time"`. Supported `direction` values are `"ascending"` and `"descending"`. If `sort` is not provided, then the most recently edited results are returned first.

direction.description: The direction to sort. Possible values include `ascending` and `descending`.

timestamp.description: The name of the timestamp to sort against. Possible values include `last_edited_time`.

filter.description: A set of criteria, `value` and `property` keys, that limits the results to either only pages or only databases. Possible `value` values are `"page"` or `"database"`. The only supported `property` value is `"object"`.

value.description: The value of the property to filter the results by.  Possible values for object type include `page` or `database`.  **Limitation**: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `database`)

property.description: The name of the property to filter by. Currently the only property you can filter by is the object type.  Possible values include `object`.   Limitation: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `database`)

start_cursor.description: A `cursor` value returned in a previous response that If supplied, limits the response to results starting after the `cursor`. If not supplied, then the first page of results is returned. Refer to [pagination](https://developers.notion.com/reference/intro#pagination) for more details.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list to include in the response. Maximum: `100`.

function.name: notion-API-get-block-children
function.description: Notion | Retrieve block children

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

function.name: notion-API-patch-block-children
function.description: Notion | Append block children

block_id.description: Identifier for a [block](ref:block). Also accepts a [page](ref:page) ID.

children.description: Child content to append to a container block as an array of [block objects](ref:block)

after.description: The ID of the existing block that the new block should be appended after.

function.name: notion-API-retrieve-a-block
function.description: Notion | Retrieve a block

function.name: notion-API-update-a-block
function.description: Notion | Update a block

type.description: The [block object `type`](ref:block#block-object-keys) value with the properties to be updated. Currently only `text` (for supported block types) and `checked` (for `to_do` blocks) fields can be updated.

archived.description: Set to true to archive (delete) a block. Set to false to un-archive (restore) a block.

function.name: notion-API-delete-a-block
function.description: Notion | Delete a block

function.name: notion-API-retrieve-a-page
function.description: Notion | Retrieve a page

filter_properties.description: A list of page property value IDs associated with the page. Use this param to limit the response to a specific page property value or values. To retrieve multiple properties, specify each page property ID. For example: `?filter_properties=iAk8&filter_properties=b7dh`.

function.name: notion-API-patch-page
function.description: Notion | Update page properties

page_id.description: The identifier for the Notion page to be updated.

properties.description: The property values to update for the page. The keys are the names or IDs of the property and the values are property values. If a page property ID is not included, then it is not changed.

in_trash.description: Set to true to delete a block. Set to false to restore a block.

icon.description: A page icon for the page. Supported types are [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) or [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object).

cover.description: A cover image for the page. Only [external file objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) are supported.

function.name: notion-API-post-page
function.description: Notion | Create a page

children.description: The content to be rendered on the new page, represented as an array of [block objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/block).

icon.description: The icon of the new page. Either an [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object) or an [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object)..

cover.description: The cover image of the new page, represented as a [file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object).

function.name: notion-API-create-a-database
function.description: Notion | Create a database

properties.description: Property schema of database. The keys are the names of properties as they appear in Notion and the values are [property schema objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/property-schema-object).

function.name: notion-API-update-a-database
function.description: Notion | Update a database

title.description: An array of [rich text objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/rich-text) that represents the title of the database that is displayed in the Notion UI. If omitted, then the database title remains unchanged.

description.description: An array of [rich text objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/rich-text) that represents the description of the database that is displayed in the Notion UI. If omitted, then the database description remains unchanged.

properties.description: Property schema of database. The keys are the names of properties as they appear in Notion and the values are [property schema objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/property-schema-object).

function.name: notion-API-retrieve-a-database
function.description: Notion | Retrieve a database

database_id.description: An identifier for the Notion database.

function.name: notion-API-retrieve-a-page-property
function.description: Notion | Retrieve a page property item

page_size.description: For paginated properties. The max number of property item objects on a page. The default size is 100

function.name: notion-API-retrieve-a-comment
function.description: Notion | Retrieve comments

block_id.description: Identifier for a Notion block or page

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

function.name: notion-API-create-a-comment
function.description: Notion | Create comment

parent.description: The page that contains the comment

function.name: local-python-execute
function.description: Execute Python code directly under the agent workspace, and returns stdout, stderr, return code, and execution time in a structured format.

code.description: Python code to execute (can be directly pasted into a .py file)

filename.description: Filename for the Python file (including .py extension). If not provided, a random UUID will be used.

timeout.description: Maximum execution time in seconds. Cannot exceed 120 seconds. If a value greater than 120 is provided, it will be automatically limited to 120 seconds. Default is 30 seconds.

function.name: local-claim_done
function.description: claim the task is done

function.name: local-search_overlong_tooloutput
function.description: Search within overlong tool output content using regex patterns and return first page with session ID

shortuuid.description: The shortuuid identifier for the overlong tool output

pattern.description: The regex pattern to search for in the content

page_size.description: Number of matches per page (default: 10, max: 50)

context_size.description: Characters of context around each match (default: 1000)

function.name: local-search_overlong_tooloutput_navigate
function.description: Navigate through search results using search session ID

search_session_id.description: The search session ID returned from search_overlong_tool

target_page.description: Target page number (required for jump_to_page action)

function.name: local-view_overlong_tooloutput
function.description: View overlong tool output content with pagination and return first page with session ID

shortuuid.description: The shortuuid identifier for the overlong tool output

page_size.description: Number of characters per page (default: 10000, max: 100000)

function.name: local-view_overlong_tooloutput_navigate
function.description: Navigate through view content using view session ID

view_session_id.description: The view session ID returned from view_overlong_tool

target_page.description: Target page number (required for jump_to_page action)

function.name: local-check_context_status
function.description: Query current conversation context status, including turn statistics, token usage, truncation history and other information

function.name: local-manage_context
function.description:
Manage conversation context by deleting historical messages to free up space. Supports multiple strategies:
- keep_recent_turns: Keep the most recent N turns of conversation
- keep_recent_percent: Keep the most recent X% of conversation  
- delete_first_turns: Delete the earliest N turns of conversation
- delete_first_percent: Delete the earliest X% of conversation

action.description: Operation to execute, currently only supports truncate

value.description: Numeric parameter, for turns methods it's number of turns, for percent methods it's percentage (0-100)

function.name: local-smart_context_truncate
function.description:
Smart context truncation tool that precisely controls retained content by specifying ranges.
Accepts 2D list [[start1,end1],[start2,end2],...,[startN,endN]], each sublist represents a closed range to retain (both ends included).
Indexing starts from 0, ranges cannot overlap, must be arranged in order.

ranges.description: List of ranges to retain, format: [[start1,end1],[start2,end2],...], indexing starts from 0

function.name: local-search_history
function.description: Search history conversation records. Support multiple keyword search or regular expression search, return records containing all keywords. Support paging to browse all results.

keywords.description: Search keyword list or regular expression list, will find records matching all patterns

use_regex.description: Whether to treat keywords as regular expressions

function.name: local-view_history_turn
function.description: View the complete conversation content of a specific turn, including the context of previous and subsequent turns. Support content truncation to view long content.

context_turns.description: Display the context of previous and subsequent turns

truncate.description: Whether to truncate long content (keep the first 500 and last 500 characters)

function.name: local-browse_history
function.description: Browse history records in chronological order, support forward or backward browsing. Can choose whether to truncate long content.

direction.description: Browse direction: forward from early to late, backward from late to early

truncate.description: Whether to truncate long content display

function.name: local-history_stats
function.description: Get statistics of history records, including total turns, time range, message type distribution, etc.

function.name: local-search_in_turn
function.description: Search content within a specific turn, support regular expressions. Used to find specific information in long content (such as tool output).

jump_to.description: Jump to: 'first'(first page), 'last'(last page), 'next'(next page), 'prev'(previous page), or specific page number

messages.content:
Please find all developers' branches in the `BenchTasksCollv3` project for the most recent commits that added new tasks. For each person’s new tasks, check the development status (do not check the file content). If the implementation satisfies the requirements, it is considered implemented; otherwise, it is considered implementing. Update our Notion page: `Task Tracker` based on the new tasks, and create a new branch in GitHub named finalpool, adding all of the implemented tasks in Notion Page to finalpool, with the relative path in the project being `tasks/finalpool`.

Tips:

- You could find the requirements in `tasks/examples`
- In addition to the content requirements explicitly mentioned in the examples, only the existence of the file needs to be checked
